content: REVOLVING FUND. The United States Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury, administered by the Foundation. It consists of appropriated amounts and funds paid in. The Foundation can spend necessary sums for operating the Institute, including salaries, mediation services, and other expenses. The Revolving Fund is separate from the Trust Fund and is not subject to certain program priorities. The Revolving Fund, separate from the Trust Fund, is not subject to certain program priorities. The Secretary of the Treasury can invest the Fund in interest-bearing obligations of the United States. The Revolving Fund allows the Secretary of the Treasury to sell obligations at market price, with proceeds and interest credited back to the Fund. SEC. 7. USE OF THE INSTITUTE BY A FEDERAL AGENCY. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include a new section allowing the use of the Institute by a federal agency. The Federal agency can utilize the Foundation and the Institute for assessment, mediation, or related services regarding environmental, public lands, or natural resource disputes. Payment for services can be made through a contract with funds going into a Revolving Fund. Prior notification to the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality is required before using the Foundation or Institute for services. The President's Council on Environmental Quality must be notified before utilizing the Foundation or Institute for services related to environmental disputes involving multiple federal agencies. The notification should include details on the issues, prior efforts to resolve them, and any other relevant information. Additionally, concurrence from the chairperson of the Council is required in cases of disputes between federal agencies. Before using the Foundation or Institute for services related to environmental disputes involving multiple federal agencies, the Federal Government must obtain the concurrence of the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality. SEC. 8. Authorization of appropriations for the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund, with specific amounts allocated for fiscal years 1998 through 2002. SEC. 9. Conforming amendments. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amendments are made to the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992, changing references from "Fund" to "Trust Fund" in various sections.
